message.content:
cs.RO, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.HC

Reasoning: 
1. cs.RO (Robotics) - The paper presents a framework for teleoperation of humanoid robots using a novel approach for motion retargeting through inverse kinematics over the robot model. This falls under the domain of robotics and hence, cs.RO is the most likely sub-category.
2. cs.CV (Computer Vision) - The paper may involve computer vision techniques for tracking the human operator's movements and gestures, which can be used to control the humanoid robot. Hence, cs.CV is a likely sub-category.
3. cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) - The paper may involve AI techniques for learning and adapting to the human operator's movements and preferences, which can be used to improve the teleoperation performance. Hence, cs.AI is a likely sub-category.
4. cs.LG (Machine Learning) - The paper may involve machine learning techniques for training the inverse kinematics model for motion retargeting, which can be used to improve the scalability and adaptability of the system. Hence, cs.LG is a likely sub-category.
5. cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction) - The paper may involve HCI techniques for designing an intuitive and natural interaction between the human operator and the humanoid robot, which can be used to improve the usability and user experience of the system. Hence, cs.HC is a likely sub-category.
